授業方法: Face to face formatStudents will practice all four skills (listening, speaking, reading, writing) over the course of the semester. Homework assignments will often be used for discussions in later classes. Projects/presentations will require students to do some research and will focus on developing small and large group presentation skills.

第1回:
Course introduction
Sharing learner histories: language learning and study
Learning plan introduction
1. Goal Setting
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Learner history. Goal setting, finding resources.
第2回: Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Reviewing resources, trying them out.
第3回: Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Trying multiple learning strategies.
第4回: 4. Skill development - language use and practice
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Trying multiple practice strategies.
第5回: 5. Reflection - assessing and fine-tuning progress
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Study and practice with assessment.
第6回: 6. SURE plan (Study, Use, Review, Evaluate) introduction
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Complete SURE plan draft.
第7回: 7. SURE plan troubleshooting and feedback, begin paper 1 (explanation of plan and rationale)
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Work on short paper, slides.
第8回: 8. Short presentations on learning plans
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Begin learning cycle, reflection.
第9回:
9. Adjusting learning plans based on assessment
Learning Cycle Week 1 small group and class reflections
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Continue learning plan, reflection.
第10回:
10. Motivation
Learning Cycle Week 2 small group and class reflections
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Continue learning plan, reflection.
第11回:
11. Communities
Learning Cycle Week 3 small group and class reflections
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Continue learning plan, reflection.
第12回:
12. Health and well-being
Introduction to final paper
Learning Cycle Week 4 small group and class reflection
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Continue learning plan, reflection. Draft of final paper.
第13回:
13. Group Feedback on draft papers
Reviewing slide design and presentation skills
Learning Cycle Week 5 small group and class reflections
Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Finish learning plan cycles, reflection. Prepare for presentation.
第14回: Students should expect 60-90 minutes of homework per each class session. Submit slide file from presentation and final paper.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are expected to complete all the tasks assigned each week, in order to prepare for the class activities.

教科書/Required texts0: All necessary course materials will be provided by the class teacher.
学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1
※kwicへのリンクとなります（在学生のみ閲覧可）

Teacher will provide further questions as well as both written and verbal feedback for learning journals and vocabulary journals, papers, and presentations in order to prompt further learning. Clear rubrics will be provided and marked for vocabulary journals, papers, and presentations. Learning journals contributes to homework grade and is based upon satisfactory completion and response to teacher questions.
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: • Learning plan paper and presentation (20%) • Vocabulary Journals (10%) • Participation (30%) • Homework and Reflection (20%) • In-Class Final Presentation (20%)
成績評価Grading2: 備考　Note Intensive English: Students who are absent 6 times or are late 10 times automatically fail. 30 minutes late or more constitutes an absence. Two late arrivals result in one unexcused absence.
